Sure, here are some updated ideas for crafting an intro for "Da Fall Thru" that you can use for each episode:

1. Start with a catchy phrase or tagline that introduces the show, such as "Welcome to Da Fall Thru, where we bring you the best in music production and beatmaking!"
2. Use visual effects and graphics to grab the viewer's attention, such as a logo or animation that represents the show's theme.
3. Introduce yourself and give a brief overview of the show's concept, such as "I'm ShaunPro, and on Da Fall Thru, we'll be showcasing the latest techniques and tools in music production, from electronic to hip hop and beyond."
4. Preview what the viewer can expect to see in the episode, such as "In this episode, we'll be exploring the world of modular synthesis and how to create unique and complex sounds with it."
5. End the intro with a call to action, such as "Make sure to hit that subscribe button and join me on this journey into the world of music production!"

For the outro, here are some ideas for a deep, poetic, and sincere closing line:

* "Music is the heartbeat of the world, and together we'll keep it beating strong."
* "Through the power of music, we can connect and inspire each other to be our best selves."
* "May the beats we create on this show bring joy and healing to all who hear them."
* "Let's continue to create and innovate in the world of music production, and leave a lasting impact on the world."

Remember to keep the outro in line with the tone and theme of the show, and to speak from the heart. By doing so, you'll be able to end each episode on a powerful and memorable note.
I'd like to include my name as well as the tagline "the humble genius" into the closing lines.

Sure, here are some updated ideas for crafting an intro and outro for "Da Fall Thru" that you can use for each episode:

Intro:

1. Start with a catchy phrase or tagline that introduces the show, such as "Welcome to Da Fall Thru, where we bring you the best in music production and beatmaking with the humble genius, ShaunPro!"
2. Use visual effects and graphics to grab the viewer's attention, such as a logo or animation that represents the show's theme.
3. Introduce yourself and give a brief overview of the show's concept, such as "I'm ShaunPro, the humble genius, and on Da Fall Thru, we'll be showcasing the latest techniques and tools in music production, from electronic to hip hop and beyond."
4. Preview what the viewer can expect to see in the episode, such as "In this episode, we'll be exploring the world of modular synthesis and how to create unique and complex sounds with it."
5. End the intro with a call to action, such as "Make sure to hit that subscribe button and join me on this journey into the world of music production with the humble genius, ShaunPro!"

Outro:

* "Thanks for joining me on this episode of Da Fall Thru, with the humble genius, ShaunPro. Until next time, keep those beats flowing and never stop creating."
* "I'm ShaunPro, the humble genius, and I hope you've enjoyed this episode of Da Fall Thru. Until next time, let's keep pushing the boundaries of music production and make some magic."
* "Thanks for tuning in to Da Fall Thru with the humble genius, ShaunPro. Until next time, keep creating and never give up on your dreams."

Remember to keep the intro and outro in line with the tone and theme of the show, and to speak from the heart. By doing so, you'll be able to start and end each episode on a powerful and memorable note.
Please make the outro deep and poetic yet funky and fun

Sure, here are some updated ideas for crafting an outro for "Da Fall Thru" that is deep, poetic, funky, and fun:

* "Thanks for tuning in to another episode of Da Fall Thru, where we bring the beats and the vibes. Until next time, keep those creative juices flowing and never stop making magic with your music."
* "I'm ShaunPro, the humble genius, and I hope you've enjoyed this journey into the world of music production with me. Until next time, let's keep creating and elevating the game. Peace out!"
* "Thanks for joining me on another episode of Da Fall Thru, where we bring the beats and the soul. Until next time, keep on grooving and never stop creating those funky fresh beats."
* "I'm ShaunPro, the humble genius, and I'm grateful for your support on this journey of music production. Until next time, let's keep the beats bumping and the creativity flowing. Peace out!"

Remember to keep the outro in line with the tone and theme of the show, and to speak from the heart. By doing so, you'll be able to end each episode on a powerful and memorable note.
Help me write a script for episode 1: "An intro to ShaunPro" in which I'd like to reintroduce myself to the world as a budding, creative, seasoned music producer that loves music technology.

Sure, here is a sample script for episode 1 of "Da Fall Thru," titled "An Intro to ShaunPro":

[Intro music and graphics]

[ShaunPro speaking to the camera]
Hey there, welcome to the first episode of "Da Fall Thru"! My name is ShaunPro, and I'm a music producer and beatmaker with a passion for music technology.

[Cut to b-roll of ShaunPro working in his home studio]

[ShaunPro speaking to the camera]
I've been making music for as long as I can remember, and over the years, I've honed my skills and learned to use a wide range of music production tools and techniques. I'm excited to share my journey with you on this show, and to explore all the amazing possibilities that music technology has to offer.

[Cut to b-roll of ShaunPro working on a beat]

[ShaunPro speaking to the camera]
In this episode, I want to give you a little taste of what I do and what you can expect to see on "Da Fall Thru." We'll be showcasing the best in music production, from electronic to hip hop and beyond, and I'll be sharing my insights and experiences with you along the way.

[Cut to b-roll of ShaunPro performing live]

[ShaunPro speaking to the camera]
So if you're into music production, beatmaking, or just love hearing great music, then "Da Fall Thru" is the show for you. Make sure to hit that subscribe button and join me on this journey into the world of music technology!

[Outro music and graphics]

This is just a sample script, and you can tailor it to your own voice and style. The key is to introduce yourself and the show in a way that is engaging and informative, and to give the viewer a sense of what they can expect to see on future episodes. Good luck with "Da Fall Thru"!
I'd like to have this ready for the second week of January 2023. Help me plan this out, but in HTML Table format by day and hour.

Sure, here is a sample schedule for getting episode 1 of "Da Fall Thru" ready for the second week of January 2023: Monday: * Plan out the beats and production techniques you'll be showcasing in the episode * Write a script or outline for the episode * Set up and test your equipment, including cameras, microphones, and music production software Tuesday: * Record the audio for the episode * Record any interviews or guest appearances * Begin editing the audio Wednesday: * Record the video for the episode * Edit the video to match the audio Thursday: * Finalize the editing and post-production process * Create any graphics or visual effects needed for the episode Friday: * Preview and finalize the episode * Create social media content to promote the episode, such as teaser trailers and behind-the-scenes photos Saturday: * Take a break and relax! Sunday: * Upload the episode to your preferred platform (YouTube, Twitch, etc.) * Promote the episode on social media and other channels Here is the schedule in HTML table format:
